item.title: My dev logs
item.heading: Example heading, idk
item.description: This is a sample description, that will be visible in the devlog list.This only has single line.
item.content:
This is the content that will be visible when the user clicks on any card in the devlog list. This can have multiple lines. This can also have html tags for flexibilty For exxample This is sentence is in italics This sentence is in bold or i could just do this word in bold and italics Also it supports my own custom schenaigans like for example censoring. like this : This sentence is censored PS: it says It is repalced by full block, U+2588 (â–ˆ). Or you could censor a particular word for example this word. Here only first and second last word is visible, everything else is just asterisk aka (*).Why you ask? My Fxxxxng will. This applies to to whole sentences, applying to every word od the sentence. Or Giched texts like this: abracadabra and this is heavy glitched The glitch works by fetching fonts from the fonts directory, counting the numbers of letters betwwen the tag(excluding spaces), or if none is given just guesses a random number between 3 and 7 and then replaces the font of every letter with a random font, also while replacing the letter to a random letter. I know, confusing. Also this is controlled by the intensity which has a range of 2 to 10 (could go up but,imma get dizzy).
Here is a link to my GitHub using an anchor tag.
This is a blockquote. It looks cool with the left border. A quick list:
one little sheep
two little sheep
three little sheep
And some inline code snippet Because why not?
Also heres an image of a cute clippy:
Btw Happy Valentine's Day for those who do celebrate it (I don't, I'm single ðŸ˜­)

item.title: List of Linux kernels code names
item.heading: List of Linux kernels code names
item.description: List of Linux kernels code names, made by me.
item.content:
As the Release of Kernel 7.0 is around the corner, I decided to make a list of Linux kernels code names. Just to remember the intersting code names by Linus Torvalds.
This list was made possible by Wikipedia. They did wonderful job of listing every name, and the context behind it. You can also see other really cool stuff that was implemented in the kernel over the course of the time. like when the AppArmour was first implemented. or when the support for real time device tree was implemented first.
Here is a list of Linux kernels code names in order of release:
1.2 - Linux '95
1.3 - Greased Weasel
2.6.2â€“2.6.4 - Feisty Dunnart
2.6.5â€“2.6.9 - Zonked Quokka
2.6.11 - 2.6.13 - Woozy Numbat (first one to be managed by git)
2.6.14 - Affluent Albatross
2.6.15 - Sliding Snow Leopard
2.6.16.28-rc2 - Stable Penguin (1st LTS)
2.6.17-rc6â€“2.6.17 - Crazed Snow-Wease l
2.6.17-rc5 - Lordi Rules (Eurovision 2006 winners)
2.6.18â€“2.6.19 - Avast! A bilge rat!
2.6.20 - Homicidal Dwarf Hamster
2.6.21 - Nocturnal Monster Puppy
2.6.22-rc3â€“2.6.22-rc4 - Jeff Thinks I Should Change This, But To What?
2.6.22-rc5â€“2.6.22 - Holy Dancing Manatees, Batman!
2.6.23-rc4â€“2.6.23-rc6 - Pink Farting Weasel
2.6.23-rc7â€“2.6.23â€“2.6.24 - Arr Matey! A Hairy Bilge Rat!
2.6.24.1 - Err Metey! A Heury Beelge-a Ret!
2.6.25 - Funky Weasel is Jiggy wit it
2.6.26â€“2.6.27 - Rotary Wombat
2.6.27.3 - Trembling Tortoise
2.6.28-rc1â€“2.6.28-rc6 - Killer Bat of Doom
2.6.28 - Erotic Pickled Herring
2.6.28-rc1â€“2.6.28-rc6 - Killer Bat of Doom
2.6.29 - Temporary Tasmanian Devil
2.6.30-rc4â€“2.6.30-rc6 - Vindictive Armadillo
2.6 & 2.9 - 2.Man-Eating Seals of Antiquity
2.6.34 - Sheep on Meth
2.6.35 - Yokohama
2.6.36â€“2.6.38 - Flesh-Eating Bats with Fangs
3.0 - Sneaky Weasel
3.1-rc2 - Wet Seal
3.1 - Divemaster Edition
3.2â€“3.5 - Saber-toothed Squirrel
3.6 to 3.7 - Terrified Chipmunk
3.8 - Unicycling Gorilla
3.8.5 - Displaced Humerus Anterior
3.9.6 - Black Squirrel Wakeup Call
3.10.6 - TOSSUG Baby Fish
3.13 - One Giant Leap for Frogkind
3.14 - Shuffling Zombie Juror
3.16.1 - Museum of Fishiegoodies
4.0 - Named "Hurr durr I'ma [sic] sheep" (Voted by Internet people using poll)
4.1.1 - Series 4800
4.3 - Blurry Fish Butt
4.6 - Charred Weasel(?)
4.7 - Psychotic Stoned Sheep
4.9 - Roaring Lionus (Yeah, his name btw)
4.10-rc5 - Anniversary Edition
4.10-rc6 - Fearless Coyote
4.14.1 - Petit Gorille
4.17 - Merciless Moray
4.19 - Named "People's Front"
4.20 - Shy Crocodile
5.2-rc2 - Golden Lions
5.2 - Bobtail Squid
5.4-rc2 - Nesting Opossum
5.4-rc5 - Kleptomaniac Octopus
5.10 - Dare mighty things
5.11 - Valentine's Day Edition
5.12 - Frozen Wasteland
5.13 - Opossums on Parade
5.15 - Trick or Treat
5.17 - Named Superb Owl
6.0 - Hurr durr I'ma [sic] ninja sloth
6.1.28 - Curry Ramen
6.10 - Baby Opossum Posse
